articles.title: About
articles.contents:
About Me
My name is Jihan Bhuiyan, and I am a rising
sophomore at Lexington High School. I am fluent in Python, C++, and
Java, and familiar with a variety of other languages including R, which
was used to make this project. Outside of coding, I am a regular
mountain hiker during the warmer months in New England and a somewhat
active one in the winter.
About the Project
I chose to do a project on monkeypox due to my interest in
epidemiology which was sparked during the COVID-19 pandemic two years
ago, in addition to my desire to help disperse the stigma around who the
virus may possibly be disproportionately affecting. I was also able to
find sufficient data enabling me to do an acceptable level of data
analysis.
Contact Links
GitHub
Project
repository
Email
Credits
This was my final project for the Kane’s Free Data Science
Bootcamp. Consider participating; it will teach you a lot in a very
short time.

articles.title: An Analysis of Monkeypox Demographics
articles.description: This project will analyze some new data about the current monkeypox outbreak.
articles.contents:
At first glance, the current outbreak of monkeypox would appear to be
disproportionately affecting men, with over 95% of confirmed cases being
recorded in such people. The dataset is from global.health, compiling
individual case data originally from a number of governmental
institutions worldwide. The data was then cleaned up and plotted in a
straightforward manner. While it may appear that monkeypox only impacts
gay and bisexual men, this conclusion doesn’t complement past outbreaks,
and is possibly due to deficits in testing.
